column4: what do i have to change in xorg.conf to get nVidia drivers running?
but i can't install nvidia drivers in jaunty and get errors when booting
what are you seeing? According to that log, everything started up right
if i go to hardware stuff in system->Hardware Drivers none is activated

also i get an error when trying to edit nvidia settings: "You do not appear to be using the NVIDIA X driver. Please edit your X configuration file (just run `nvidia-xconfig` as root), and restart the X server."
And what happens if you tell it to select the nvidia driver?
it gives me a installatino bar which stays on 0% for a few seconds and closes again
Ok, that's a bug in the restricted driver installer. File it
what do you mean with 'file it' and how does that solve my problem?
Sorry, it doesn't really solve your problem, but I'm no expert on it. What I meant was go to Launchpad and file a bug on it so that someone who knows more about it will get back to you
ah okay, really desperately want those drivers, can't even watch movies in fullscreen atm...
That's because the open-source driver in Ubuntu is the crappy "nv" driver instead of the good "Nouveau" driver
